00051 #ifdef LIBCFS_DEBUG
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * When this is on, LASSERT macro includes check for assignment used instead
00055  * of equality check, but doesn't have unlikely(). Turn this on from time to
00056  * time to make test-builds. This shouldn't be on for production release.
00057  */
00058 #define LASSERT_CHECKED (0)
00059 
00060 #if LASSERT_CHECKED
00061 /*
00062  * Assertion.
00063  *
00064  * Strange construction with empty "then" clause is used to trigger compiler
00065  * warnings on the assertions of the form LASSERT(a = b);
00066  *
00067  * "warning: suggest parentheses around assignment used as truth value"
00068  *
00069  * requires -Wall. Unfortunately this rules out use of likely/unlikely.
00070  */
00071 #define LASSERTF(cond, fmt, ...)                                        \
00072 do {                                                                    \
00073         if (cond)                                                       \
00074                 ;                                                       \
00075         else {                                                          \
00076                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(__msg_data, D_EMERG, NULL);  \
00077                 libcfs_debug_msg(&__msg_data,                           \
00078                                  "ASSERTION( %s ) failed: " fmt, #cond, \
00079                                  ## __VA_ARGS__);                       \
00080                 lbug_with_loc(&__msg_data);                             \
00081         }                                                               \
00082 } while (0)
00083 
00084 #define LASSERT(cond) LASSERTF(cond, "\n")
00085 
00086 #else /* !LASSERT_CHECKED */
00087 
00088 #define LASSERTF(cond, fmt, ...)                                        \
00089 do {                                                                    \
00090         if (unlikely(!(cond))) {                                        \
00091                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(__msg_data, D_EMERG, NULL);  \
00092                 libcfs_debug_msg(&__msg_data,                           \
00093                                  "ASSERTION( %s ) failed: " fmt, #cond, \
00094                                  ## __VA_ARGS__);                       \
00095                 lbug_with_loc(&__msg_data);                             \
00096         }                                                               \
00097 } while (0)
00098 
00099 #define LASSERT(cond) LASSERTF(cond, "\n")
00100 #endif /* !LASSERT_CHECKED */
00101 #else /* !LIBCFS_DEBUG */
00102 /* sizeof is to use expression without evaluating it. */
00103 # define LASSERT(e) ((void)sizeof!!(e))
00104 # define LASSERTF(cond, ...) ((void)sizeof!!(cond))
00105 #endif /* !LIBCFS_DEBUG */
00106 
00107 #ifdef CONFIG_LUSTRE_DEBUG_EXPENSIVE_CHECK
00108 
00113 # define LINVRNT(exp) LASSERT(exp)
00114 #else
00115 # define LINVRNT(exp) ((void)sizeof!!(exp))
00116 #endif
00117 
00118 #define KLASSERT(e) LASSERT(e)
00119 
00120 void lbug_with_loc(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *) __attribute__((noreturn));
00121 
00122 #define LBUG()                                                          \
00123 do {                                                                    \
00124         LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_EMERG, NULL);             \
00125         lbug_with_loc(&msgdata);                                        \
00126 } while(0)
00127 
00128 extern atomic_t libcfs_kmemory;
00129 /*
00130  * Memory
00131  */
00132 #ifdef LIBCFS_DEBUG
00133 
00134 # define libcfs_kmem_inc(ptr, size)             \
00135 do {                                            \
00136         atomic_add(size, &libcfs_kmemory);      \
00137 } while (0)
00138 
00139 # define libcfs_kmem_dec(ptr, size)             \
00140 do {                                            \
00141         atomic_sub(size, &libcfs_kmemory);      \
00142 } while (0)
00143 
00144 # define libcfs_kmem_read()                     \
00145         atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory)
00146 
00147 #else
00148 # define libcfs_kmem_inc(ptr, size) do {} while (0)
00149 # define libcfs_kmem_dec(ptr, size) do {} while (0)
00150 # define libcfs_kmem_read()     (0)
00151 #endif /* LIBCFS_DEBUG */
00152 
00153 #ifndef LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE
00154 #define LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE        (2 << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) /* 2 pages */
00155 #endif
00156 
00157 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC_PRE(size, mask)                                        \
00158 do {                                                                        \
00159         LASSERT(!in_interrupt() ||                                          \
00160                 ((size) <= LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE &&                           \
00161                  ((mask) & GFP_ATOMIC)) != 0);                      \
00162 } while (0)
00163 
00164 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC_POST(ptr, size)                                        \
00165 do {                                                                        \
00166         if (unlikely((ptr) == NULL)) {                                      \
00167                 CERROR("LNET: out of memory at %s:%d (tried to alloc '"     \
00168                        #ptr "' = %d)\n", __FILE__, __LINE__, (int)(size));  \
00169                 CERROR("LNET: %d total bytes allocated by lnet\n",          \
00170                        libcfs_kmem_read());                                 \
00171         } else {                                                            \
00172                 libcfs_kmem_inc((ptr), (size));                             \
00173                 CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "alloc '" #ptr "': %d at %p (tot %d).\n",  \
00174                        (int)(size), (ptr), libcfs_kmem_read());             \
00175         }                                                                   \
00176 } while (0)
00177 
00182 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, size, mask)                                   \
00183 do {                                                                        \
00184         LIBCFS_ALLOC_PRE((size), (mask));                                   \
00185         (ptr) = (size) <= LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE ?                             \
00186                 kzalloc((size), (mask)) : vzalloc(size);                    \
00187         LIBCFS_ALLOC_POST((ptr), (size));                                   \
00188 } while (0)
00189 
00193 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC(ptr, size) \
00194         LIBCFS_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, size, GFP_NOFS)
00195 
00199 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC_ATOMIC(ptr, size) \
00200         LIBCFS_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, size, GFP_ATOMIC)
00201 
00208 #define LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, cptab, cpt, size, mask)                   \
00209 do {                                                                        \
00210         LIBCFS_ALLOC_PRE((size), (mask));                                   \
00211         (ptr) = (size) <= LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE ?                             \
00212                 cfs_cpt_malloc((cptab), (cpt), (size), (mask) | __GFP_ZERO) : \
00213                 cfs_cpt_vzalloc((cptab), (cpt), (size));                    \
00214         LIBCFS_ALLOC_POST((ptr), (size));                                   \
00215 } while (0)
00216 
00218 #define LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(ptr, cptab, cpt, size)                             \
00219         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, cptab, cpt, size, GFP_NOFS)
00220 
00221 #define LIBCFS_FREE(ptr, size)                                          \
00222 do {                                                                    \
00223         int s = (size);                                                 \
00224         if (unlikely((ptr) == NULL)) {                                  \
00225                 CERROR("LIBCFS: free NULL '" #ptr "' (%d bytes) at "    \
00226                        "%s:%d\n", s, __FILE__, __LINE__);               \
00227                 break;                                                  \
00228         }                                                               \
00229         libcfs_kmem_dec((ptr), s);                                      \
00230         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "kfreed '" #ptr "': %d at %p (tot %d).\n",     \
00231                s, (ptr), libcfs_kmem_read());                           \
00232         if (unlikely(s > LIBCFS_VMALLOC_SIZE))                          \
00233                 vfree(ptr);                                             \
00234         else                                                            \
00235                 kfree(ptr);                                             \
00236 } while (0)
00237

00240 /* htonl hack - either this, or compile with -O2. Stupid byteorder/generic.h */
00241 #if defined(__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ >= 2) && !defined(__OPTIMIZE__)
00242 #define ___htonl(x) __cpu_to_be32(x)
00243 #define ___htons(x) __cpu_to_be16(x)
00244 #define ___ntohl(x) __be32_to_cpu(x)
00245 #define ___ntohs(x) __be16_to_cpu(x)
00246 #define htonl(x) ___htonl(x)
00247 #define ntohl(x) ___ntohl(x)
00248 #define htons(x) ___htons(x)
00249 #define ntohs(x) ___ntohs(x)
00250 #endif

00262 # ifdef LIBCFS_DEBUG
00263 #  undef NDEBUG
00264 #  include <assert.h>
00265 #  define LASSERT(e)     assert(e)
00266 #  define LASSERTF(cond, ...)                                                  \
00267 do {                                                                           \
00268           if (!(cond))                                                         \
00269                 CERROR(__VA_ARGS__);                                           \
00270           assert(cond);                                                        \
00271 } while (0)
00272 #  define LBUG()   assert(0)
00273 #  ifdef CONFIG_LUSTRE_DEBUG_EXPENSIVE_CHECK
00274 #   define LINVRNT(exp) LASSERT(exp)
00275 #  else
00276 #   define LINVRNT(exp) ((void)sizeof!!(exp))
00277 #  endif
00278 # else
00279 #  define LASSERT(e) ((void)sizeof!!(e))
00280 #  define LASSERTF(cond, ...) ((void)sizeof!!(cond))
00281 #  define LBUG()   ((void)(0))
00282 #  define LINVRNT(exp) ((void)sizeof!!(exp))
00283 # endif /* LIBCFS_DEBUG */
00284 # define KLASSERT(e) ((void)0)
00285 # define printk printf
00286 #define LIBCFS_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, size, mask)       \
00287 do {                                            \
00288         (ptr) = calloc(1, size);                \
00289 } while (0)
00290 # define LIBCFS_FREE(ptr, size) do { free(ptr); } while((size) - (size))
00291 # define LIBCFS_ALLOC(ptr, size)                                \
00292          LIBCFS_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, size, 0)
00293 # define LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC_GFP(ptr, cptab, cpt, size, mask)      \
00294          LIBCFS_ALLOC(ptr, size)
00295 # define LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(ptr, cptab, cpt, size)                \
00296          LIBCFS_ALLOC(ptr, size)

00300 int libcfs_debug_cleanup(void);

00302 #define libcfs_debug_dumpstack(tsk)     ((void)0)

00304 /*
00305  * Generic compiler-dependent macros required for kernel
00306  * build go below this comment. Actual compiler/compiler version
00307  * specific implementations come from the above header files
00308  */
00309 #define likely(x)      __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
00310 #define unlikely(x)    __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
00311 /* !__KERNEL__ */
00312 #endif
00313 
00314 /*
00315  * allocate a variable array, returned value is an array of pointers.
00316  * Caller can specify length of array by count.
00317  */
00318 void *cfs_array_alloc(int count, unsigned int size);
00319 void  cfs_array_free(void *vars);

00321 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_ENABLED          (1)
00322 
00323 #if LASSERT_ATOMIC_ENABLED
00324 
00326 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_EQ(a, v)                                 \
00327 do {                                                            \
00328         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) == v,                       \
00329                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00330 } while (0)
00331 
00333 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_NE(a, v)                                 \
00334 do {                                                            \
00335         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) != v,                       \
00336                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00337 } while (0)
00338 
00340 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_LT(a, v)                                 \
00341 do {                                                            \
00342         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) < v,                        \
00343                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00344 } while (0)
00345 
00347 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_LE(a, v)                                 \
00348 do {                                                            \
00349         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) <= v,                       \
00350                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00351 } while (0)
00352 
00354 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT(a, v)                                 \
00355 do {                                                            \
00356         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) > v,                        \
00357                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00358 } while (0)
00359 
00361 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE(a, v)                                 \
00362 do {                                                            \
00363         LASSERTF(atomic_read(a) >= v,                       \
00364                  "value: %d\n", atomic_read((a)));          \
00365 } while (0)
00366 
00368 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LT(a, v1, v2)                         \
00369 do {                                                            \
00370         int __v = atomic_read(a);                           \
00371         LASSERTF(__v > v1 && __v < v2, "value: %d\n", __v);     \
00372 } while (0)
00373 
00375 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LE(a, v1, v2)                         \
00376 do {                                                            \
00377         int __v = atomic_read(a);                           \
00378         LASSERTF(__v > v1 && __v <= v2, "value: %d\n", __v);    \
00379 } while (0)
00380 
00382 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE_LT(a, v1, v2)                         \
00383 do {                                                            \
00384         int __v = atomic_read(a);                           \
00385         LASSERTF(__v >= v1 && __v < v2, "value: %d\n", __v);    \
00386 } while (0)
00387 
00389 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE_LE(a, v1, v2)                         \
00390 do {                                                            \
00391         int __v = atomic_read(a);                           \
00392         LASSERTF(__v >= v1 && __v <= v2, "value: %d\n", __v);   \
00393 } while (0)
00394 
00395 #else /* !LASSERT_ATOMIC_ENABLED */
00396 
00397 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_EQ(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00398 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_NE(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00399 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_LT(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00400 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_LE(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00401 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00402 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE(a, v)                 do {} while (0)
00403 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LT(a, v1, v2)         do {} while (0)
00404 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LE(a, v1, v2)         do {} while (0)
00405 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE_LT(a, v1, v2)         do {} while (0)
00406 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE_LE(a, v1, v2)         do {} while (0)
00407 
00408 #endif /* LASSERT_ATOMIC_ENABLED */
00409 
00410 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(a)                  LASSERT_ATOMIC_EQ(a, 0)
00411 #define LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(a)                   LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT(a, 0)

00413 #define CFS_ALLOC_PTR(ptr)      LIBCFS_ALLOC(ptr, sizeof (*(ptr)));
00414 #define CFS_FREE_PTR(ptr)       LIBCFS_FREE(ptr, sizeof (*(ptr)));

00430 #define CLASSERT(cond) do {switch (1) {case (cond): case 0: break; } } while (0)
00431 
00432 /* implication */
00433 #define ergo(a, b) (!(a) || (b))
00434 /* logical equivalence */
00435 #define equi(a, b) (!!(a) == !!(b))
00436 
00437 /* what used to be in portals_lib.h */
00438 #ifndef MIN
00439 # define MIN(a,b) (((a)<(b)) ? (a): (b))
00440 #endif
00441 #ifndef MAX
00442 # define MAX(a,b) (((a)>(b)) ? (a): (b))
00443 #endif

00445 #define MKSTR(ptr) ((ptr))? (ptr) : ""
00446 
00447 static inline size_t cfs_size_round4(size_t val)
00448 {
00449         return (val + 3) & (~0x3);
00450 }
00451 
00452 #ifndef HAVE_CFS_SIZE_ROUND
00453 static inline size_t cfs_size_round(size_t val)
00454 {
00455         return (val + 7) & (~0x7);
00456 }
00457 #define HAVE_CFS_SIZE_ROUND
00458 #endif
00459 
00460 static inline size_t cfs_size_round16(size_t val)
00461 {
00462         return (val + 0xf) & (~0xf);
00463 }
00464 
00465 static inline size_t cfs_size_round32(size_t val)
00466 {
00467         return (val + 0x1f) & (~0x1f);
00468 }
00469 
00470 static inline size_t cfs_size_round0(size_t val)
00471 {
00472         if (!val)
00473                 return 0;
00474         return (val + 1 + 7) & (~0x7);
00475 }
00476 
00477 static inline size_t cfs_round_strlen(char *fset)
00478 {
00479         return cfs_size_round(strlen(fset) + 1);
00480 }
00481 
00482 #define LOGL(var,len,ptr)                                       \
00483 do {                                                            \
00484         if (var)                                                \
00485                 memcpy((char *)ptr, (const char *)var, len);    \
00486         ptr += cfs_size_round(len);                             \
00487 } while (0)
00488 
00489 #define LOGU(var,len,ptr)                                       \
00490 do {                                                            \
00491         if (var)                                                \
00492                 memcpy((char *)var, (const char *)ptr, len);    \
00493         ptr += cfs_size_round(len);                             \
00494 } while (0)
